intro: Kohautia virgata var. oblanceolata, commonly known as the slender kohautia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This variety is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is adapted to the temperate climate of its native habitat. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in New Zealand's flora.
